## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `ec`

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
summary(df)
librar
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
df <-read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Smillersfsu/Biol708/refs/heads/main/Code/ELKVEG2016.csv")

```

```{r}
ggplot(data =df) +
  geom_jitter(aes(x =Distance , y = Orthometric.Height, color=SiteID )) +
    labs(x = "Distance",
       y = "Othrometric Height",
       title = "Variance of Orthometric Height With Distance Across Transects of Elkhorn Slough") + geom_smooth(aes(x= Distance, y= Orthometric.Height, color=SiteID)) +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 7)) + 
  theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, size = 7))
```

`ho: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}

ggplot(data =df) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = Distance , y = Cover, color =SiteID)) +
    labs(x = "Distance",
       y = "Cover",
       title = "Variance of Cover of Pickleweed Across Distance ") + geom_smooth(aes(x= Distance, y= Cover, color=SiteID )) +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(legend.title=element_blank()) + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, size = 14))
```
